Kay,
 
Everything Frank R. just said I have been preaching for a year.
It =
is alway's about the harmony and positive energy.
 
And anyone knows that t=
he technology is just a way of getting the message across.
The whole meanin=
g of my post was misconscrued it was only meant to spark some energy 
to mo=
ve foward with all the research, technical and spiritual.
 
But sadly Kay m=
y posts here are carefully scrutinised by some, and the slightest miswordin=
g
or lack of clarity in a post will present certain people with the opportu=
nity to take a shot.
 
That is the reason I left this group a couple of mon=
ths ago.
I returned hoping to help people, but when I try to pass on any kn=
owledge gained from experience
Some feel threatened and a nedd to countermi=
ne anything I say.
 
When was the last time you read a post From Frank R.
 =

This post and a couple of others will probably not make it to the board.
I=
f not you will all recieve private copies.
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EV=
P-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: psfponies@...: Mon, 21 Apr 2008 21:01:=
22 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: The Research Must Move Forward (it's a long =
post but important please read)




Thanks FrankKay--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps.com, "Frank" <warrior18eii@...> wrote:>> Bingo Kay and William! The stre=
ngth of your connection and the clarity> of your messages depends on the st=
rength of the bond or bridge you> develop with your friends on the othersid=
e. The equipment is only> needed to materialize the message. This is why yo=
u can use almost> anything as a medium to bring them across.> > I love to s=
ee people learn on their own through their own reasoning.> > Regards,> > Fr=
ank R.> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@> wr=
ote:> >> > I think your correct Kay!> > > > psfponies <psfponies@> wrote: B=
ruce > > > > I hate to say it but out of all the responses I have heard Mik=
e > > Edwards seem to get the best reponses to his questions on his > > cli=
ckity 12-469 shack hack box. I think advancement isnt just about > > the eq=
uipment you use but the relationship you develop with the > > spirits. > > =
> > Kay> > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "bhali333" > > <paranormalin=
vestigating@> wrote:> > >> > > > > > Hi Everyone,> > > > > > I would like t=
o make a serious suggestion.> > > As a senior researcher in the live spirit=
 communication field, > > Myself > > > and a few other researchers here suc=
h as Steve hultay, Ann, LC> > > Just to mention a couple have strived since=
 the beginning to try > > and > > > advance the technology, communication a=
nd relations with our > > spirit > > > friends or whatever entities are par=
ticipating in this > > communication > > > research.> > > > > > In order to=
 call this research it must continue to move forward.> > > There are more t=
han enough of the new people here, that do not > > > qualify as new people =
anymore. But full fledged researchers. Of > > > course they have much to le=
arn, but so do we all.> > > > > > Which brings me to my suggestion.> > > St=
eve and I have recently been discussing the point we have > > reached > > >=
 in the research, both in process and knowledge. We agreed on most > > > po=
ints,> > > the most important one being. It is time to move beyond the same=
 > > > mundane session content and the same rudimentary line of > > questio=
ning.> > > > > > This research is stagnating for lack of direction, any pos=
ted > > files > > > or discussions revolve around the same stale subjects s=
uch as, > > > "Is there anyone there that wishes to communicate", > > > "Wh=
at is your name"> > > "who am I speaking with"> > > "what is it like where =
you are"> > > > > > I believe we have all received every combination of ans=
wer to > > those > > > questions that we possibly can, yet we continue to a=
sk them > > session > > > after session. And still become amazed at a yes o=
r no answer or > > the > > > simplest of phrases.> > > > > > I am not sayin=
g this about any single level of researcher but all > > of > > > us myself =
included have fallen into this rut. We are not learning > > > anything, All=
 our efforts are amounting to nothing.> > > > > > We already know that we a=
re communicating with someone or > > something. > > > I believe we have all=
 come to believe that through our personal > > > research and the evidence =
presented by all of us.> > > > > > Within the last year the technology and =
potential of this type of > > > research has exceeded all expectations in i=
t's quality and speed > > of > > > development. We are actually letting it =
go to waste.> > > > > > I and a few other researchers believe that whoever =
is on the other > > > side of the line has had a hand in some of us develop=
ing this new > > > equipment and methods of research be it obvious or subtl=
e.> > > > > > But our methods of research have not excelled, we are conduct=
ing > > > research in the same manner as we did when there where only about=
 > > 5 > > > of us in the whole world actively doing this research.> > > > =
> > New individuals are joining our ranks and becoming interested in > > bo=
x > > > research every day. The protocol they are being instructed to use >=
 > is > > > antiquated and obsolete.> > > > > > It is fine to teach them th=
ese methods as a basic foundation of > > the > > > research and to get thei=
r feet wet. But like any other education > > > process it must evolve and d=
evelop with the accumulation of > > knowledge.> > > > > > If we approached =
academic education the way we approach box > > research, > > > we would all=
 still be in the first grade.> > > > > > I propose a committee to develop a=
 method of research and protocol > > > that can deal with the ever evolving=
 technology and decide what > > and > > > how we should approach the type o=
f communication we seek and the > > > subject matter that should be address=
ed, that will be continually > > > changing.> > > > > > Only in this way wi=
ll the wheels of research and learning move > > > forward and we will gain =
the knowledge we seek and hopefully be > > able > > > to share it with the =
world someday.> > > > > > But if we continue to ask "Is anyone there willin=
g to speak with > > me"> > > We are doomed.> > > > > > Anyone that wishes t=
o discuss this and give opinions or suggestions> > > please lets try and ge=
t started every minute we waste is a missed > > > opportunity for learning.=
> > > > > > Bruce> > >> > > > > > > > > > > > > > -------------------------=
--------> > Be a better friend, newshound, and know-it-all with Yahoo! Mobi=
le. > Try it now.> >>
